result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas J. Kirkland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.
Consecutive to: Sentence shall commence on or before Court ordered start date;  with work release and transfer privileges

records.addlTxt: Defendant, Nicholas J. Kirkland in court, Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held. Defendant filed petition for appointment of counsel. Discussion held. Court finds eligible and appoints Atty Joe Fischer at rate of $50/month comm 1/15/16 and 15th of each month until paid.
Return date at 12-14-2015 01:30 pm

(1:57) Def. FTA for Return Date; State appears by Kurt Klomberg; State requests warrant and JT removed; Court authorizes warrant, forfeits bond and removes JT; Court calls Def.- Def. says his car broke down, called this morning and left a message; Court requests RD reset to next Mon., discussion held; Def. is attempting to hire an attorney; Def. is unaware that he could petition the court for attorney; Court orders clerk to send Petition with notice for next Monday and will hear his Petition next Mon.; Def. now wants to speak with the DA; Court concludes hearing for DA to speak with Def. on the phone; bond con.

9:08 - Defendant, Nicholas J. Kirkland in court, Intern Kevin Schmidt for DA Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. RD & JT set. Court enters Not Guilty plea. Court sets $500 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Return date scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.
